Introduction
I am a herpetologist interested in a range of topics in herpetology, especially involving venomous snakes. These include: (i) Venom at the interface between snakes and environment: the selective drivers of venom composition and evolution, and the wider evolutionary consequences of venom (ii) Systematics, phylogeny and biogeography (iii) Ecology and evolutionary biology, invasive species, conservation

Projects

Projects (10)
Snakes, venoms and bites: integrating snake biology and toxinology to reduce the snakebite burden
Project
Snakebite is a major Neglected Tropical Disease, killing over 100,000 people annually, mostly in the rural tropics. Integrating research on snake diversity, taxonomy, distribution and ecology with toxinological research and work on treatments is essential to reduce the burden of this NTD.
View
Venomics of Vipera latastei (Lataste's viper) from the Iberian Peninsula
Project
1) Describe the venom proteome of V. latastei 2) Assess levels of geographic variability of V. latastei venom 3) Look for differences in venom composition between adults and juveniles 4) Analyse the findings of points 2 and 3 from an ecological point of view, considering the species' diet and habitat
View
Bio-geographical History of North America Snakes
Project
To ascertain the bio-geographical history of certain snake species, found throughout North America. Bio-geography of species will be determined through niche analysis using GIS and MaxEnt.
